lead_paragraph: Scott Dixon pulled ahead of Dario Franchitti on two counts yesterday: He took advantage of a late collision by Franchitti to win the Motorola Indy 300 in Sonoma, Calif., and he took over the lead in the IndyCar Series championship standings with two races remaining.Franchitti started the 80-lap race at Infineon Raceway from the pole and held an 8-point lead over Dixon in the standings. Dixon won for the fourth time this season. Hélio Castroneves was second; Franchitti, who collided with Marco Andretti on Lap 69, was third.
